 * @file    CKCU/Clock_Configuration/readme.txt
 * @version V1.01
 * @date    2019-12-20
 * @brief   Description of CKCU example.
Example Description:

This example describes how to configure the system clock to get different frequencies of 8 MHz, 24 MHz, 48 MHz and 60 MHz that have been defined in main.c.

Call function CKCU_GetClocksFrequency to get the current clocks setting. The ClockFreq structure configures the different frequencies on chip.

This example also shows the HSE (High Speed External clock) monitor function. If HSE clock fails (maybe broken), HSI will be selected as the system clock source. NMI exception will then be generated if the clock stuck interrupt was enabled. In the NMI handler, enables the HSE ready interrupt so that once the HSE clock is recovered, the HSE ready interrupt can be generated.

In the CKRDY handler, the system clock can be reconfigured.

The HSE clock output is on the CKOUT pin.

Toggle three LEDs with a timing delay.

Directory Contents:
  • CKCU/Clock_Configuration/main.c Main program
  • CKCU/Clock_Configuration/ht32fxxxx_it.c Interrupt handlers
Hardware and Software Environment:
  • Refer "ht32_board_config.h" to change another frequency.
  • Use LED1, LED2 and LED3 of HT32 Development board.
  • This example can be run on HT32 Series development board.
